results.title: Beds and appliances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
This film, produced by the U.S. Navy, demonstrates how to make and manipulate beds for the sick and injured (particularly those bedridden for extended periods of time) so that the patient’s comfort is increased and their recovery is thereby quickened. Demonstrates how to make a bunk as well as a bed in a ward so that the bedclothes do no need adjusting during the day, and also includes handy tips for materials which can be used to improvise elevations and inclines to vary a patient’s position in bed. No other credits available.

results.title: Bathing the bed patient
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Procedure for making a bed with a minimum of disturbance to the patient. Also demonstrates the proper method of washing the patient with as much comfort as posible.

results.title: Canoeing safely
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Underlines some of the dangers which abound on almost every river and canal and shows ways of taking sensible precautions to avoid these dangers. Topics covered include life; hazards; paddling skills; an ‘H’ rescue; canoe buoyancy aids; weirs; capsize drill; stopper waves; emergency packs; bridges and a ‘T’ rescue.

results.title: Making a canoe
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Two boys, with the help of an adult instructor, make a slalom canoe from glass reinforced plastic. The processes involved are shown step by step. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: First time afloat
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Intended for the complete newcomer to canoeing, this films shows the importance of never canoeing without a lifejacket. Shows methods of getting afloat, simple paddling strokes, and how to choose a route. Also shows how easy it is to escape from a capsize, and deals with how to land both canoeist and canoe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films

results.title: Basic strokes
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Shot in both still and fast moving water, shows all the simple skills needed to paddle a canoe. Shows forward strokes, sculling draw, slap support, sculling for support, reverse paddle, sweep stroke, draw stroke, low telemark and hanging draw.

results.title: Catskinner Keen
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “West”.
Bob Keen is almost larger than life - big in stature, self-made millionaire, already part of the legend of the Northwest. His fortunes began with a second-hand caterpillar tractor, bulldozing mountain roads. Now he owns - oil land, operates road, water and air transport, flies a plane, drives a chuckwagon, and is listed on the stock exchange. For all that, he’s a modest man who still likes yarning by a campfire with old cowpuncher pals in the big game country of the Rockies. (Award: Hollywood)

group_siblings.title: We're here to stay

results.title: We're here to stay
results.creator_credit: Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “West”.
That is the resolve of Agri-Pool, seven farm families in Lestock, Saskatchewan, who have pooled their resources so that rising operating costs will not drive them off their land. By pooling their land, their equipment, their livestock, and farming as a cooperative, they are able to live as they choose, to maintain their standard of living, and even to have some spare time left over to enjoy. This is an engaging look at a novel approach to big-scale farming.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
